title: Keynote
description: Join us and stay up to speed on everything happening at the Fundamental Library! Discover new ways to use the Fundamental Library to your advantage.

speakers.bio: Mladen (Deno) has been part of Fundamental Library from its inception, and he is excited to be working with such talented people and team. Prior to that he was working on different frontend and backend solutions.

title: How to foster the creative breed in a corporate world
description: The corporate and creative worlds come with limiting factors that might hold back ideas. In this environment, you will find a mage-like species of designers, eager to overcome obstacles. Always hungry for innovation and pushing boundaries, they devoured rules, claiming the right to bend them. Our speakers Jasmin and Alex invite you to their creative lab. You will learn about different approaches and recipes for brewing magic potions to develop joyful designs and sparks of innovation. In the end, both worlds (corporate and creative) gain and thrive.

speakers.bio: UX Designer with focus on visual design, rookie/newbie, as I joined SAP a year ago, coming from the branding and advertising world. It’s a new adventure to now work inside the corporate world, as the years before I was only looking at it from the outside perspective.
speakers.fun: I am not afraid of spiders or heights, but I hate nail files.

speakers.bio: UX Designer, pushing pixels in SAP since 2014. Started as a Visual Designer for UI Control Framework. Creation of a control library is a process where you sacriface the creativity in favor of consistency and usability, but there is always a field for innovation.
speakers.fun: I have a master degree in Sculpture and once celebrated my birthday at 5642m

title: From UX Designer to Business Designer: The new reality!
description: Our customers are facing tons of challenges on their way to become an Intelligent Enterprise. In times of a global pandemic crisis even more than before. The SAP AppHaus team has been helping more than 1000 customers on their journey to become an Intelligent Enterprise since almost ten years. In this talk I will give you an overview how UX designers need to expand their area of expertise in order to drive better outcomes for our customers by combining key principles of SAP’s Human Centered Approach to Innovation, Enterprise Architecture and the power of SAP Business Technology Platform. UX Designers can accelerate their career by learning more about business and technology and becoming a Business Designer.

speakers.role: Senior Vice President, SAP AppHaus Network
speakers.bio: Andreas leads a global team offering co-innovation services for customers to accelerate their digital transformation journey to the cloud. With more than 20 years of experience with leading global design, design thinking and innovation teams, he has developed a passion for humanizing business software through design and putting people at the center of all activities.

title: Drawing parallels between Architecture and UX design
description: Thousands of years ago a famous Roman architect defined three key attributes, which architectural objects should have: strength, usability and beauty. Probably back then he didn't expect that these three words would also describe the features of a good UX product. Let's dive into the parallel worlds of architecture and UX design and explore the similarities they share in common.

speakers.bio: Anna-Mariya Hristova is a UX Design Specialist аt SAP. She is a former architect and has а few years of professional experience in construction and interior design. Exploring the parallels between architecture and UX design is her passion. She has shared her thoughts in Medium articles and several events.
speakers.fun: I have a lovely dog named Kai. He's a staffy and pitbull mixture :)

title: Fundamentally Changing Enterprise Web IDEs
description: Throughout the years, software development has changed and the way we use and expect our Web IDEs to behave has also changed. We decided that it's time to rethink and modernize the UI and UX of Eclipse Dirigible using SAP Fundamental Styles. We will talk about why we made that decision, what we changed, the current status of the effort and what our future plans are.

speakers.bio: Stan is a UI designer, software developer and system administrator at Quanterall, making use of various languages and UI toolkits. He has designed and developed software solutions for workstations, Kiosk systems, Internet of Things, Web and mobile. He has been a part of many open and closed source projects since the early 2010s. Personal interests include reading, music, vintage electronics, retro cars and restoration projects.
speakers.fun: I'm a vintage headphone collector and restorer.

title: New Horizon Visual Theme and the Qualities of Enterprise Design
description: What are the features of the new Horizon visual themes and how are they consumed by the Fundamentals development team? In this presentation we give an overview of the Horizon visual language foundations, the theming concept and the qualities of visually accessible, enterprise design.

speakers.bio: Simone is leading the central Visual Design team within the Web Design Systems area at SAP. Together with her team colleagues she is focusing on the visual language of SAP's design system. She is passionate about constantly evolving the visual design foundations, control specifications and the underlying design logic.

speakers.role: UX Visual Design Expert and Fiori for Web Co-Visual Design Lead
speakers.bio: Born in Ireland, I moved to Germany more than ten years ago. In that time I have been working together with the Fiori for web design team at SAP headquarters, focusing on the visual language foundations, theming concepts and UI framework specifications to ensure the highest quality of enterprise software.

Sebastian Rousseau is  part of the central visual design team at SAP. The team is responsible for crafting both the fundamental visual identity of the UI, including the typography, iconography, illustrations, colors, and design tokens, as well as the UI element appearance for the design system, to cater for the highest enterprise design standards.

title: Animating in Vue
description: Sometimes our applications need a little 'wow' and we can do this with some movement, just the perfect amount to make them more alive. I will exemplify why we even use animations in our web applications, how we can use them to capture the user's attention or how we can communicate important information quickly to our users. In this talk, I will show you how to use Vue magic to create fantastic animations, combining Vue with animation libraries, from simple to more complex ones. We will look at how to make the most of Vue's <Transition> component and when and how to use more complex animation libraries like GSAP.

speakers.bio: Web Developer, passionate about all things web, especially anything Vue related. Data visualization is my side passion.

title: Designing for the Enterprise User of Today and Tomorrow
description: Enterprise users come to SAP to get their work done as efficiently and accurately as possible, so they can get on with the rest of their day. They often have no choice but use our software - it comes along with the job - in contrast to consumer software, where users can choose what apps they use. And in today’s world of hybrid, flexible work, the barrier between work and private life has blurred like never before. This means we have anextra responsibility to our users, to ensure their enterprise experiences both help them get their work done in the best way possible, but also in a way that can be engaging and enjoyable, wherever and whenever they need to use it. In this talk, we’ll highlight the unique aspects to keep in mind when designing for enterprise users, how we see the way work will adapt in the future, and the implications that has for designing the best, most supportive experiences at work. And we can best prepare for that future, we’ll show how we re-imagine our experiences through building ‘concept cars’ hand in hand with our users and product teams, that help us push our design system and technologies forward to define and validate where the future of enterprise design should be..

speakers.bio: As Chief Technical Advisor in SAP Design, Phil helps guide and drive the technical adoption and realization of our design system through engaging with products and technology partners to build intuitive, strategic, prototypes that help shape SAP's UX technology strategy. Having worked within SAP Design for the past 8 years, he relentlessly asks himself and others how user experiences can be tailored to enhance the “I” in AI and make work more natural. Phil holds a PhD in Computer Science, specialising in self-adaptive computing via machine learning methods and has published over 30 international research papers. He also has extensive experience in software security. As part of the SAP security response team, Phil led SAP's security advisory management, defining how SAP develops and coordinates its technical quality assurance processes for security vulnerability fixes, and controlled the delivery of security advisories to customers.

title: How Libraries Support Inclusion Through Efficient Design and Development Cycles
description: Eager to start working on accessible by design? Begin with libraries. A solid design library aligned to the UI development library is the right recipe to create successful inclusive product blueprints. The blueprint specifies accessibility on the design phase presenting annotations to support legal guidelines that must be fulfilled. Make the inclusive Design strategy efficient matching UI components from the library used to create the design and the UI control library used to implement. Enhance the Design library that supports designers to build new screens and features informing aspects of accessibility in the context of the component. It is expected that the UI control is implemented to match the designed experience in order to achieve an efficient design and implementation process. But this can only be achieved with though an efficient communication process across two main stakeholders: design and UI development.

speakers.role: UX Design Expert and Accessibility Lead
speakers.bio: After 20 years of practicing design I choose accessibility as a design continuing learning pathway. After embracing the challenge with all with my heart I started seeing design problems with more clarity to find more inclusive solutions and experiences. My mission is to work with accessibility as we designers do with usability - Effortless. If you are a curious designer interested in expanding your reach, you found a multiplier interested in sharing lessons learned.
speakers.fun: Cheese lover. I collect pencils. I am a proud architect who had the privilege to meet Oscar Niemeyer.

speakers.bio: PhD Physical Chemistry - the heat is on. In Accessibility for 10+ years now, mostly with UI development. Accessible design influencer since 1.5 years.
speakers.fun: Love playing piano, singing and being a hobby dancer.

title: Scalable enterprise architectures with Nrwl NX
description: Keeping the high quality of code and proper structure of how elements and components interact with each other within the application is a major part of software development. Although some concessions and compromises might not have an impact on small-sized projects or early development stages of applications, as long as your code-base continues to grow, you have to deal with growing complexity to further develop, maintain and deploy it. Nrwl NX is a technology aimed to help you every step of the way. In this talk, we will have a look at how it can help you to work effortlessly with projects of any size.

title: How Playwright made me fall in love with E2E testing again
description: Every good testing strategy includes E2E testing as an essential part. And yet, despite there being lots of guides on how to do it and a plethora of testing frameworks, it still seems like setting up, writing and running E2E tests becomes a chore more often than not. Even worse, modern web application development requires support for different features like opening new tabs or working with iframes for microfrontends which exacerbates the problems. Playwright is a modern E2E testing framework which supports all modern rendering engines (Chromium, WebKit and Firefox) and all platforms (Windows, Linux, macOS), either headed or headless, locally or on CI. Tests can be written in TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, .NET and Java. It features automated waiting on DOM elements, retryable assertions, reaches every part of the (shadow) DOM and a great toolkit with the possibilities of generating tests by recording actions, doing detailed test inspection and viewing recorder traces of tests. Working with multiple tabs, contexts, users and iframes is easy and Playwright has a big following on GitHub while being backed by Microsoft. Writing tests in Playwright is straightforward and based on Promises without the usage of extendable global objects or magic.

speakers.bio: I'm a Software Engineer Jack-of-all-trades at SAP interested in the whole stack and beyond. Still, the Frontend and its quirks and perks are my first and biggest love and I have been following the Web since creating a web application meant developing with tables and before jQuery got popular.
